The Football Transfer Sources Reliability Guide

Football Transfer Source Reliability Tiers

Tier 1 – Almost undisputed when discussing a Transfer Rumour. They may not be the first to discuss a rumour, but if they are talking about it; then it is almost certainly true, and possibly close to complete.
Tier 2 – Known to have current sources, but are still fallible and just short of being considered an authority on rumour discussions. However, multiple individuals or sources from this tier reporting the same rumour may indicate a strong possibility of truth to the rumour.
Tier 3 – Unreliable, and not to be trusted solo. They fall into near click-bait practices and are often fighting for relevance in a sea of rumours.
Tier 4 – Not to be trusted at all. These companies make money out of ensuring that you read them and they will make up anything to get you to harness advertising revenue.
Tier 5 – Don’t waste your time reading them

Sead Kolašinac has met Schalke sporting director Jochen Schneider ahead of potential move

Bild report tonight that Arsenal left-back Sead Kolašinac has met with Schalke sporting director Jochen Schneider three times in the past few weeks ahead of a potential loan deal.

The 27-year-old would like to return to his former club but for Schalke, it may not be financially feasible. The Bundesliga club must reach an agreement with Arsenal on how the Bosnian’s salary would be divided during his loan spell.

Arsenal appear to be willing to allow Kolašinac, who wants to return to Schalke for personal reasons, to leave the club. Bayer Leverkusen have also shown interest in signing the Bosnia international.

Vedad Ibišević undergoes Schalke medical

Former Hertha Berlin striker Vedad Ibišević has completed part one of his medical check and will undergo further tests on Wednesday before signing a one-year deal, according to Sport1.

The 36-year-old will take a considerable pay cut to join the Royal Blues, who are expected to complete the signing of Ibišević within the next 48 hours.

Juventus and Atalanta in advanced talks over Romero: the details on the formula of the transfer

Atalanta continues to take in reinforcements for their defense. After bidding farewell to Castagne who heads to Leicester and closing for Karsdorp from Roma, the club is also preparing to make a decisive push for Juventus-owned center back Cristian Romero. Talks are in progress with the bianconeri.

The player's valuation is between €20-25m, the clubs are in negotiations over the formula: it could be a loan with fee for one year plus an purchase option which could become a forced option at certain conditions, or a two-year loan (still with purchase option which could become a forced option.)

Romero was purchased by Juventus in the summer of 2019, with the bianconeri leaving him on loan at Genoa where he played in 33 matches last season.

Napoli's transfer market depends heavily on the future of Koulibaly: should he depart the main target to replace him is Papastathopoulos from Arsenal (sides are set to make a deal) and additionally Senesi from Feyenoord.

If Koulibaly leaves for Manchester City, Napoli would have the economic maneuverability to try to make improvements in other positions, such as Boga of Sassuolo for the attack and Veretout the Roma midfielder to replace Allan.

Sassuolo's asking price for Boga is €40m, and Veretout would require Roma selling a year after making an investment in him.

Lyon reject low ball bid from Fulham for winger Bertrand Traoré

Premier League side Fulham have had an opening bid for Burkina Faso international Bertrand Traoré rejected by Lyon, according to our colleagues at Foot Mercato.

OL are seeking a €25m fee for a player that they are actively seeking to offload this summer – Sky Sports were the first outlet to report the Cottagers’ interest in Traoré.

Brighton are also very interested in the ex-Chelsea man and are weighing up a bid, whilst Newcastle United, Everton and Crystal Palace have all been targeted by agents but have not yet made any move for the 24-year-old.
Leicester City are interested in St Étienne central defender Wesley Fofana, but no formal bids at this stage, according to sources contacted by Get French Football News. More follows.

Marseille seeking to offload Lopez, Mitroglou, Strootman, Rocchia & Germain

La Provence report that Marseille have informed five players that they should move on during this transfer window.

They are midfielders Kevin Strootman & Maxime Lopez, left-back Christopher Rocchia. Strikers Valère Germain & Kostas Mitroglou.

OM will also look to sign a new striker, and have a budget of between €5m to €6m to do so. The profile of player they are looking for a is a youngster who can be sold on for much more within the next two years.

Adil Rami talks with Serie B side Reggina break down

Talks between 34-year-old French international central defender Adil Rami and Serie B side Reggina have broken down, according to L’Équipe.

Reggina expected to sign the Frenchman this week, but the club’s Sporting Director, Massimo Taibi, announced that talks are off: “We are no longer expecting anyone, we have decided to bring negotiations to an end.”

Sofiane Boufal available for €4m

Our colleagues at Foot Mercato report that 26-year-old Moroccan international attacking midfielder Sofiane Boufal has been made available by Southampton this summer for €4m.

Under contract with the Saints until June 2021, now the player feels is the time find a club and a coach who believe in him and his dribbling and breaking the lines qualities. At the moment, there is nothing concrete, aside from strong interest from Real Betis.

Atalanta make contact for St Étienne attacker Denis Bouanga

Serie A side Atalanta have entered into contact with Gabonese international Denis Bouanga about a possible transfer from St Étienne, according to our colleague Mohamed Toubache-TER.

The 25-year-old is in active discussions with the Italian side, but ASSE have not received a formal offer from the Champions’ League quarter-finalists as of yet.

Atalanta had also been looking at Marseille winger Florian Thauvin, but sources tell Get French Football News that they have concerns relating to the asking price.

Mike McGrath's transfer notebook: Everton keeping tabs on Valencia striker Maxi Gomez

Meanwhile, Tiemoue Bakayoko nears Chelsea exit and Danny Graham returns to Sunderland

Everton have asked about Valencia striker Maxi Gomez to add a striker to Carlo Ancelotti's summer spending.

Gomez, 24, will be allowed to leave the Mestalla ahead of the transfer deadline in October as the Spanish club look to trim their squad to cut costs.

Ancelotti has made moves for Allan and Abdoulaye Doucoure for his midfield and playmaker James Rodriguez but would also welcome an out-and-out striker and has interest in Gomez.

The Uruguay striker moved to Valencia a year ago from Celta Vigo for £13million but they will take a hit on their investment as they look to sell players.

Ancelotti has Dominic Calvert-Lewin as a No9 and has also played Richarlison up front, while Moise Kean has fallen out of favour.

Tiemoue Bakayoko almost off Chelsea's books

Chelsea midfielder Tiemoue Bakayoko has edged closer to a move to AC Milan but has also been monitored by Crystal Palace.

Palace have previously taken Ruben Loftus-Cheek and Michy Batshuayi on loan and Conor Gallagher has been lined up this season, with Bakayoko also on their radar.

Everton considered the Frenchman, 26, but ended up signing Allan from Napoli. There does not appear to be hope of Bakayoko spending the campaign at Stamford Bridge as he is not training with the first team.

Danny Graham returns to Weirside

Danny Graham has joined Sunderland on an initial one-year deal after leaving Blackburn Rovers this summer.

It is a return to the Stadium of Light for the 35-year-old after leaving the north-east for Ewood Park four years ago.

Fulham's Steven Sessegnon to get loan time

Fulham full-back Steven Sessegnon has agreed a season-long loan at Bristol City in the Championship to give him first-team experience.

The 20-year-old is behind Antonee Robinson in the pecking order at Craven Cottage following his arrival from Wigan Athletic.

Manager Peter Bosz wants to sign Thauvin to associated him up front with Moussa Diaby and Partick Schick, who they have just bought for €27m.
